entity1.name: human body
entity1.description: The complex and intricate system of the human organism, including all its organs, tissues, and cells.
entity1.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections1

entity2.name: defense mechanisms
entity2.description: The processes within an organism that protect against disease by identifying and neutralizing pathogens and tumor cells.
entity2.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections1

entity3.name: pathogens
entity3.description: Disease-causing microorganisms, including bacteria, viruses, fungi, and parasites.
entity3.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections1

entity4.name: bacteria
entity4.description: Single-celled microorganisms that can exist either as independent organisms or as parasites.
entity4.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections1

entity5.name: viruses
entity5.description: Infectious agents that are only able to replicate inside the living cells of other organisms.
entity5.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections1

entity6.name: fungi
entity6.description: Eukaryotic organisms that include microorganisms such as yeasts and molds, as well as mushrooms.
entity6.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections1

entity7.name: parasites
entity7.description: Organisms that live on or in a host organism and get their food from or at the expense of the host.
entity7.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections1

entity8.name: pathogens
entity8.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections2

entity9.name: immune system
entity9.description: The body's defense against infectious organisms and other invaders.
entity9.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections2

entity10.name: infection
entity10.description: An invasion of an organism by a pathogen that can cause disease.
entity10.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections2

entity11.name: cells
entity11.description: The basic structural and functional units of living organisms.
entity11.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections3

entity12.name: tissues
entity12.description: Groups of cells that work together to perform a specific function in the body.
entity12.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections3

entity13.name: organs
entity13.description: Structures composed of two or more tissue types that work together to perform specific functions in the body.
entity13.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections3

entity14.name: human body
entity14.description: The physical structure of a human, including all its organs and systems.
entity14.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections4

entity15.name: infections
entity15.description: Diseases caused by the invasion of microorganisms such as bacteria, viruses, or fungi into the body.
entity15.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections4

entity16.name: immune system
entity16.description: A complex network of cells, tissues, and organs that work together to defend the body against pathogens and other foreign substances.
entity16.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections4

entity17.name: physical barriers
entity17.description: Physical structures of the body that prevent pathogens from entering, such as skin and mucous membranes.
entity17.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections5

entity18.name: pathogens
entity18.description: Disease-causing organisms, including bacteria, viruses, fungi, and parasites.
entity18.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections5

entity19.name: skin
entity19.description: The outer covering of the body that acts as a protective barrier.
entity19.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections6

entity20.name: pathogens
entity20.description: Disease-causing organisms such as bacteria, viruses, and fungi.
entity20.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections6

entity21.name: deeper tissues
entity21.description: The internal layers of the body beneath the skin.
entity21.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections6

entity22.name: mucous membranes
entity22.description: Tissues lining the body cavities and canals that are exposed to the external environment, such as in the respiratory and digestive tracts.
entity22.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections7

entity23.name: respiratory tract
entity23.description: The pathway of air entering and leaving the lungs, including the nose, mouth, pharynx, larynx, trachea, bronchi, and lungs.
entity23.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections7

entity24.name: digestive tract
entity24.description: The pathway through which food passes in the body, including the mouth, esophagus, stomach, small intestine, large intestine, and anus.
entity24.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections7

entity25.name: mucus
entity25.description: A slippery secretion produced by mucous membranes that serves to protect and lubricate surfaces in the body.
entity25.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections7

entity26.name: pathogens
entity26.description: Disease-causing organisms, including bacteria, viruses, fungi, and parasites.
entity26.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections7

entity27.name: stomach
entity27.description: The muscular, hollow, acid-producing organ of the digestive system that is located in the upper abdomen.
entity27.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections8

entity28.name: pathogens
entity28.description: Disease-causing microorganisms such as bacteria, viruses, fungi, or parasites.
entity28.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections8

entity29.name: physical barriers
entity29.description: Structures in the body that prevent pathogens from entering and causing infections.
entity29.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections9

entity30.name: infections
entity30.description: The invasion of an organism's body tissues by disease-causing agents, their multiplication, and the reaction of host tissues to these organisms and the toxins they produce.
entity30.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections9

entity31.name: immune system
entity31.description: A complex network of cells, tissues, organs, and molecules that work together to defend the body against foreign invaders such as bacteria, viruses, and other pathogens.
entity31.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections9

entity32.name: pathogens
entity32.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections10

entity33.name: immune system
entity33.description: A complex network of cells, tissues, and organs that work together to defend the body against infections and other diseases.
entity33.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections10

entity34.name: immune system
entity34.description: A complex network of cells, tissues, and organs that work together to identify and eliminate pathogens.
entity34.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections11

entity35.name: pathogens
entity35.description: Disease-causing organisms such as bacteria, viruses, fungi, or parasites.
entity35.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections11

entity36.name: white blood cells
entity36.description: A type of cell in the immune system that defends the body against infectious diseases and foreign invaders.
entity36.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections12

entity37.name: neutrophils
entity37.description: A type of white blood cell that is part of the innate immune system, primarily involved in fighting bacterial infections.
entity37.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections12

entity38.name: macrophages
entity38.description: Large phagocytic cells found in tissues throughout the body, which play a crucial role in innate immunity by ingesting and destroying pathogens and cellular debris.
entity38.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections12

entity39.name: lymphocytes
entity39.description: A type of white blood cell that is part of the adaptive immune system, involved in producing antibodies and mediating specific immune responses.
entity39.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections12

entity40.name: cells
entity40.description: Cells are the basic structural and functional units of living organisms. In this context, they refer to immune cells that play a role in detecting and destroying pathogens.
entity40.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections13

entity41.name: pathogens
entity41.description: Pathogens are microorganisms that can cause disease. They include bacteria, viruses, fungi, and parasites.
entity41.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections13

entity42.name: Neutrophils
entity42.description: A type of white blood cell that is the most abundant and acts as a first responder to infections.
entity42.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections14

entity43.name: white blood cells
entity43.description: Cells of the immune system that protect the body against both infectious disease and foreign invaders.
entity43.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections14

entity44.name: infection
entity44.description: The invasion of an organism's body tissues by disease-causing agents, their multiplication, and the reaction of host tissues to these organisms and the toxins they produce.
entity44.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections14

entity45.name: pathogens
entity45.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections15

entity46.name: phagocytosis
entity46.description: A cellular process by which a cell engulfs and destroys foreign particles or microorganisms.
entity46.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections15

entity47.name: Macrophages
entity47.description: A type of white blood cell that plays a crucial role in the immune response by engulfing and digesting pathogens and cellular debris.
entity47.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections16

entity48.name: white blood cell
entity48.description: A component of the immune system that defends the body against infectious diseases and foreign invaders.
entity48.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections16

entity49.name: immune response
entity49.description: The reaction of the immune system to a foreign substance, such as a pathogen or toxin, which results in the elimination of the invader and restoration of homeostasis.
entity49.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections16

entity50.name: pathogens
entity50.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections17

entity51.name: immune cells
entity51.description: Cells of the immune system that defend against foreign invaders in the body.
entity51.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections17

entity52.name: Lymphocytes
entity52.description: A type of white blood cell that plays a key role in the immune system, particularly in mounting targeted and specific immune responses.
entity52.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections18

entity53.name: lymphocytes
entity53.description: A type of white blood cell that is part of the immune system.
entity53.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections19

entity54.name: B cells
entity54.description: A subtype of lymphocytes responsible for producing antibodies as part of the adaptive immune response.
entity54.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections19

entity55.name: T cells
entity55.description: A subtype of lymphocytes that play a central role in cell-mediated immunity and can help regulate immune responses.
entity55.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections19

entity56.name: B cells
entity56.description: A type of white blood cell that produces antibodies as part of the immune system.
entity56.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections20

entity57.name: antibodies
entity57.description: Proteins produced by B cells to bind to and neutralize pathogens or toxins.
entity57.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections20

entity58.name: pathogens
entity58.description: Disease-causing microorganisms, such as bacteria, viruses, fungi, or parasites.
entity58.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections20

entity59.name: T cells
entity59.description: A type of white blood cell that plays a central role in cell-mediated immunity and can directly attack infected cells.
entity59.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections20

entity60.name: white blood cells
entity60.description: A type of cell in the immune system that helps to fight infections and diseases.
entity60.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections21

entity61.name: immune system
entity61.description: The biological system within an organism that protects against disease by identifying and killing pathogens and tumor cells.
entity61.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections21

entity62.name: dendritic cells
entity62.description: A type of immune cell that captures and presents antigens to T cells, initiating an immune response.
entity62.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections22

entity63.name: T cells
entity63.description: A type of white blood cell involved in the specific immune response, including the recognition of foreign substances and the activation of other immune cells.
entity63.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections22

entity64.name: Natural killer cells
entity64.description: A type of immune cell that can directly kill infected or cancerous cells.
entity64.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections23

entity65.name: immune cell
entity65.description: A cell of the immune system, which defends the body against infections and other harmful invaders.
entity65.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections23

entity66.name: infected cells
entity66.description: Cells that have been invaded by a pathogen or microorganism, potentially causing disease.
entity66.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections23

entity67.name: Complement proteins
entity67.description: A group of proteins that work together to enhance the ability of antibodies to destroy pathogens.
entity67.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections24

entity68.name: antibodies
entity68.description: Proteins produced by the immune system to identify and neutralize foreign objects such as bacteria and viruses.
entity68.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections24

entity69.name: pathogens
entity69.description: Disease-causing microorganisms, including bacteria, viruses, fungi, and parasites.
entity69.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections24

entity70.name: Cytokines
entity70.description: Signaling molecules that coordinate the immune response and regulate the activity of immune cells.
entity70.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections25

entity71.name: Immune Response
entity71.description: A complex biological process involving various cellular and molecular mechanisms to defend against pathogens and other harmful agents.
entity71.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections25

entity72.name: Immune Cells
entity72.description: Specialized cells of the immune system that play a role in defending the body against infectious disease and foreign invaders.
entity72.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections25

entity73.name: immune system
entity73.description: A complex network of cells, tissues, and organs that work together to defend the body against pathogens.
entity73.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections26

entity74.name: pathogen
entity74.description: An organism that can cause disease in other organisms.
entity74.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections26

entity75.name: immunological memory
entity75.description: A process by which the immune system remembers a pathogen and mounts a faster and stronger response upon subsequent exposures.
entity75.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections27

entity76.name: vaccination
entity76.description: The administration of a vaccine to stimulate an individual's immune system to develop adaptive immunity to a pathogen.
entity76.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections27

entity77.name: immune system
entity77.description: A complex network of cells, tissues, and organs that work together to defend the body against pathogens.
entity77.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections28

entity78.name: pathogen
entity78.description: An organism capable of causing disease in a host.
entity78.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections28

entity79.name: lymphocytes
entity79.description: A type of white blood cell that is part of the immune system and plays a key role in adaptive immunity.
entity79.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections29

entity80.name: immune response
entity80.description: The reaction of the body's immune system to foreign substances, such as pathogens or toxins.
entity80.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections29

entity81.name: memory cells
entity81.description: A subset of lymphocytes that have previously encountered a specific antigen and can mount a faster and stronger immune response upon re-exposure to the same antigen.
entity81.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections29

entity82.name: pathogen
entity82.description: A microorganism that can cause disease in its host, such as bacteria, viruses, fungi, or parasites.
entity82.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections29

entity83.name: immune system
entity83.description: A complex network of cells, tissues, and organs that work together to defend the body against pathogens.
entity83.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections30

entity84.name: infection
entity84.description: An invasion of an organism's body tissues by disease-causing agents, their multiplication, and the reaction of body tissues to these organisms and the toxins they produce.
entity84.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections30

entity85.name: immune response
entity85.description: A reaction of the immune system to pathogens or other foreign substances.
entity85.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections32

entity86.name: chronic inflammation
entity86.description: A prolonged inflammatory response that can cause damage to healthy tissues over time.
entity86.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections32

entity87.name: autoimmune diseases
entity87.description: Disorders in which the immune system mistakenly attacks and damages the body's own tissues.
entity87.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections32

entity88.name: Autoimmune diseases
entity88.description: A group of disorders in which the immune system attacks the body's own tissues, causing damage and dysfunction.
entity88.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections33

entity89.name: Immune system
entity89.description: The complex network of cells, tissues, organs, and molecules that work together to defend the body against pathogens and other harmful substances.
entity89.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections33

entity90.name: rheumatoid arthritis
entity90.description: A chronic inflammatory disorder affecting many joints, including those in the hands and feet.
entity90.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections34

entity91.name: lupus
entity91.description: An autoimmune disease where the body's immune system becomes hyperactive and attacks normal, healthy tissue.
entity91.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections34

entity92.name: multiple sclerosis
entity92.description: A disease in which the immune system eats away at the protective covering of nerves, interfering with the brain's ability to communicate with the rest of the body.
entity92.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections34

entity93.name: Chronic inflammation
entity93.description: A prolonged state of inflammation in the body that can last for several months or years.
entity93.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections35

entity94.name: heart disease
entity94.description: A range of conditions that affect the heart, including coronary artery disease, heart rhythm problems, and congenital heart defects.
entity94.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections35

entity95.name: diabetes
entity95.description: A group of metabolic disorders characterized by high blood sugar levels over a prolonged period.
entity95.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections35

entity96.name: cancer
entity96.description: A group of diseases involving abnormal cell growth with the potential to invade or spread to other parts of the body.
entity96.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections35

entity97.name: human body
entity97.description: The physical structure of a human being, including all its organs and systems.

entity99.description: Disease-causing organisms such as bacteria, viruses, fungi, and parasites.

entity100.name: immune response
entity100.description: A biological process that involves the body's defense mechanisms against pathogens and other harmful agents.
entity100.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections37

entity101.name: cells
entity101.description: The basic structural and functional units of living organisms, which play a crucial role in the immune response.
entity101.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections37

entity102.name: tissues
entity102.description: Groups of cells that work together to perform specific functions within an organism, including those involved in the immune system.
entity102.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections37

entity103.name: molecules
entity103.description: Small particles or structures that are essential for various biological processes, including signaling and defense mechanisms in the immune response.
entity103.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections37

entity104.name: body
entity104.description: The entire physical structure of an organism, which is protected by the immune system against infections.
entity104.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections37

entity105.name: infections
entity105.description: Diseases caused by the invasion and multiplication of pathogenic microorganisms in the body, which the immune response aims to prevent or eliminate.

entity106.description: A complex network of cells, tissues, and organs that work together to defend the body against pathogens.

entity107.description: Disease-causing organisms such as bacteria, viruses, fungi, and parasites.

entity108.name: immune system
entity108.description: A complex network of cells, tissues, and organs that work together to defend the body against pathogens and other foreign substances.

entity109.name: infections
entity109.description: Diseases caused by microorganisms such as bacteria, viruses, fungi, or parasites that invade the body and can cause illness.
entity109.chunkid: How the Human Body Fights Infections39

entity110.name: health
entity110.description: A state of complete physical, mental, and social well-being, not merely the absence of disease or infirmity.

entity111.name: disease
entity111.description: An abnormal condition in an organism that impairs bodily functions, often associated with specific symptoms and signs.
